channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large pothole in middle of road, 17th November
item.description:
Outside road around number 12 Wistley Road pothole in middle of road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Wistley Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road narrowing and traffic dealys, 17th November
item.description:
The new layout of the road at the junction of the B4063 and Pirton is an accident waiting to happen. The road is now narrowed and the traffic that needs to turn right is at risk of being hit by cars coming around the corner or hit on the passenger side due to reduced road space. The lights are causing huge queues both at this junction and also the lights at the Hare and Hounds are not functioning in a sensible sequence. School traffic is causing delays for cars coming from Parton Road and Pirton Lane. Since putting the cycle lane adjacent to the B4063 the disruption and traffic issues have increased immensely and with increased development at Imjin Barracks and more property development along the B4063 is making the area, more polluted and dangerous .Please can a traffic survey be carried out to review the traffic flows in the rush/ school drop and pick up times along this road and the junctions of the Hare and Hounds the Pirton Corner to try to resolve this please?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Temporary lights causing congestion, 17th November
item.description:
The temporary lights are causing tail backs onto the estate road and the roundabout outside G-TEM causing difficulties for workers at G-TEM getting around the roundabout and the ability to get to work.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hucclecote Road, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles

item.title: FixMyStreet ref: 8342671. Report said it’s completed but they are still there, 17th November
item.description:
There are around 7 pot holes in road Reported via mobile in the A pothole in road category anonymously at 11:03, Monday 27 October 2025 Sent to Gloucestershire County Council less than a minute later. FixMyStreet ref: 8342671. Photo of this report Photo of this report Photo of this report Outside 6 and 7 Vineries close, there are a collection of pot holes which are over 4cm in depth and are causing issues for cars I could only upload 3 pics but can do more if required I have received report that they have been fixed which they haven’t. Please can you sort as this issue isn’t sorted.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Vineries Close, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Safety Issue, 17th November
item.description:
A pavement is missing from the radi on the southern side of the carriageway, as this is an adoptable road where children cross to a school it is a major safety issue. A pavement should follow the radi of the carriageway to allow for safe crossing of the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kidnappers Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bus stop sign is badly degraded, 17th November
item.description:
The bus stop sign (for no 10 bus etc) on the left side of the road heading north opposite the Cheltenham College entrance is very badly obscured by weathering and pollution such that the sign is almost not recognisable as a bus stop sign. See photo.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bath Road, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
